message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.GT 

This paper deals with training-based channel estimation in a cloud radio access network (CRAN), which involves a large number of remote radio heads (RRHs) and users randomly scattered over the service area. The paper proposes a locally orthogonal training sequence design based on graph coloring, which reduces the overhead of assigning orthogonal training sequences to all users. This problem involves concepts from information theory (cs.IT), networking (cs.NI), signal processing (cs.SI), graph theory (cs.DS), and game theory (cs.GT). Therefore, these are the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper.
